Name: 90 Jahre IDT
Description:
The players roll the dice and must bring their two pieces to the finish. Other pieces can be captured and have to start again. The player may decide which of his figures is moved. Events flavoured by IDT company lurk along the way. The player who gets both pieces to the finish line wins.

—user summary

Name: Drakar och demoner: Gigant Fältslagsregler
Description: In 1987, the expansion "Gigant" came for the Swedish role-playing game "Drakar och demoner". The expansion contains rules for field battles that can be played with the role-playing game or separately. All that is needed is paper, pencil and dice. You can play with troops consisting of elves, dwarves, wolfmen, ratmen, centaurs, goblin wolfriders, lizardmen and more. The battles goes down in the Swedish fantasy world Ereb Altor.

Name: Albion's Legacy: Deluxe Edition
Description:
The Kickstarter Deluxe Edition contains the base game and the following expansions: Avalon, Holy Grail, Hunters, Northumbria and Romance. It is also expandable for up to 6 players. More information can be found in the Wiki.


Albion's Legacy is a cooperative, modular-adventure board game for 1-4 players.

The game allows players to participate as one of their favourite Arthurian characters ranging from the legendary wizard Merlin, the famous Lady of the Lake, the brave Sir Lancelot, and the great King Arthur himself. These heroes will champion all that is good in 90 minutes as the players travel across the realm of Albion and face dangerous roaming threats, mythical beasts and deadly encounters.

Collect lore-enriched relics, artifacts, weapons and special awards under a heated deadline while solving some of the most famous historical and mythical chronicles of the Arthurian legend.

This game will challenge you, excite you, educate you and if you're not careful it will take you down. Everything you need is provided at the gaming table, just bring your friends, your love of Arthurian lore (knowledge of Arthurian lore optional) and your thirst for adventure! Onward! The Kingdom needs YOU!
Families: Theme: King Arthur / The Knights of the Round Table / Camelot

Name: Okko Chronicles: Cycle of Water – Oni Hunters
Description:
Cooperative and solo modes for Okko Chronicles: Cycle of Water. This expansion allows players to play solo or as a team against a card-controlled Oni opponent. A new deck of reaction cards aids in the execution of the 'AI' opponent and new boar overlays for the corruption track allow for beginner and expert levels of difficulty.

This pack consists of 15 mission cards, 18 adventure cards, 154 reaction cards, 23 activation tokens, 2 board overlays for the oni's corruption track, and a rules book to explain solo and cooperative gameplay.

Name: Walk'n'Wag
Description:
Your dog scratches at the door, their whole body wiggling with anticipation. They look back at you, tongue falling out of their mouth as they grin eagerly. Your best friend knows you are busy, and they have been very patient… but now it is time for a nice, long walk.

This is a solo game about walking good dogs, trying to tire them out while keeping them as happy as possible. Choose one of the eight dogs available, or follow simple rules to create your own! Randomized card draw and weather patterns mean you'll never take the same walk twice.

To play, all you need is a deck of playing cards, a pencil and paper, and a copy of the game.

Your dog has two stats: Satisfaction and Energy.


     Your Walk ends when your Dog has 0 Energy and 10 Satisfaction, OR if you flip over every card.
     Be careful! If your dog’s energy would ever drop below 0, they instead lose 1 Satisfaction!
     If your dog’s Satisfaction would ever rise above 10, they instead gain 1 Energy!
     At the end of the Walk, give yourself 1 point for every point of Satisfaction your Dog has, and subtract 1 point for every remaining point of Energy that your Dog has.
     10 Points is a perfect score!

Name: Running With a Mouthful of Toast
Description:
Your lousy alarm clock didn’t wake you up when it was supposed to - or did you hit the snooze button too many times? You can’t remember, and at this point, that’s not important!

Because you’re about to be late for school!

Quick, get dressed, grab your bag, and don’t forget to nab a piece of toast on the way out (even in these dire circumstances, the importance of breakfast can’t be understated)!

Running With a Mouthful of Toast is a one-player game blending the silliness of Saturday morning cartoons with a handful of screwball anime tropes.

Place 11 cards face-down in a row. Place one Joker at either end of the row of cards, and the other at the opposite end. Place your token on one of the Jokers. This is your home. And see that other Joker, all the way at the other end of the row? That’s your school. You know the route well, but that doesn’t mean you’re gonna make it without any unexpected complications.

Your Time starts at 5, and it’ll go down steadily, as it is known to do. You’ll want to track this number accordingly, perhaps with a die, a piece of paper, or your phone, but be warned - if it hits 0 before you make it to school, you’ll be sent to detention!

Name: Triumvir
Description:
It’s 60 BC, and the three most powerful men in Rome form a loose alliance based on marriage, self-interest, and a thirst for power. In Triumvir, you take the role of one of these Roman power brokers as you vie for power and position that inevitably leads to Civil War.

Triumvir builds on Versailles 1919 where players use influence to gain control over issues and the path that history will take going forward. In Triumvir, you will use your three-dimensional influence in popularity, money, and legions to vie for the Consulship, Pontifex Maximus, and Governorships as you try to outmaneuver your erstwhile friends on the floor of the Senate. The game can be played with 1 – 3 players.

During your turn, you will perform one of three actions: Place influence (popularity, money, or legions) on issues that are being debated in the Senate, Recover exhausted influence, or Settle an issue. These actions are punctuated by elections, revolts in the provinces, and domestic unrest. As one of the Triumvirs, you will have to balance your tempo of activities to ensure that you are not caught short on your ability to influence how events evolve and progress.

Although Triumvir uses many of the basic mechanics from Versailles 1919, the design is thematically aligned to its subject. When an issue settles, your choices will alter your popularity and resources where the Consul often gets his cut. Each player has a unique personality card that asymmetrically captures your personality’s strengths in how they gain and recover influence. These characteristics are enhanced by your growing tableau of patrons—some of whom bring additional resources.

Revolts are intense events where the Governor of the affected province has to re-establish Roman rule. Failure to do so carries tough popularity penalties whereas success raises your stature. If you put down a particularly epic revolt in a grand fashion you can be awarded a Triumph with extra legions, but remember—sic transit gloria. The tides of fate can often turn against you in the next election or foreign war.

This political danse macabre continues until the ‘Crossing the Rubicon’ issue ends the Roman Republic and brings on a Civil War or one player dominates faction standing. Can you prevail against your political rivals as you try to dominate Rome? Your seat at the table awaits you in Triumvir.

—description from the publisher

Name: Frogmouth Fan Pack (fan expansion for Wingspan)
Description: A mini expansion created by a fan focused on different species of frogmouth. The expansion includes 14 new birds and 1 new bonus card. As a curiosity all cards have a black background.

Name: Cartagena 1741: All or Nothing
Description:
The Battle of Cartagena de Indias took place during the 1739 to 1748 War of Jenkins' Ear between Spain and Britain. The result of long-standing commercial tensions, the war was primarily fought in the Caribbean; the British tried to capture key Spanish ports in the region, including Porto Bello and Chagres in Panama, Havana, and Cartagena de Indias in present-day Colombia.

Two previous naval attacks in 1740 had failed and for the third attempt in March 1741, the British had opted for a combined naval and land attack. After a series of unsuccessful assaults in the campaign, the British were forced to retreat, having suffered over 9,500–11,500 fatalities, in great part to disease, and considerable material losses. Some units suffered death rates of 80 to 90 percent. The victory demonstrated Spain's ability to defend its position and largely ended military operations in this area. Both countries shifted their focus to the wider European War of the Austrian Succession and hostilities ended with the 1748 Treaty of Aix-la-Chapelle.

In this two-player game, one player will take the control of the Spanish forces and the other the control of the British forces. The British player will have to make a way thru the bay of Cartagena de Indias to conquer the Spanish while the Spanish player will have to defend the city to achieve victory.

Name: The Partizan Press Guide to War Gaming The Crimean War
Description:
So why wargame the Crimean War?

Colourful uniforms, organisations and tactics which are comfortably familiar to the Napoleonic war gamer, with just a hint of the technological advances to come. All this and the chance to fight along side different allies and to take on the might of Russia in the process.

So it’s not quite Napoleonics, neither is it the American Civil War. The Crimean War is its own conflict and one that can be almost as far reaching as the war gamer requires.

With an increasing number of figures and rule sets becoming available, perhaps the Crimean War could become ‘the next big thing’ in the world of war games…

Includes historical background, war gaming guidelines, full colour campaign maps and details of the forces that participated.

With scenarios for the following battles complete with full colour maps of the battles & orders of battle:

     The Battle of Kurudere - 5th August 1854
     The Skirmish on the Bulganak - 19th September 1854
     The Battle of the Alma - 20th September 1854
     The Siege of Sevastopol September 1854 - September 1855
     The Battle of Balaclava - 25th October 1854
     The Battle of Inkerman - 5th November 1854
     The Battle of Eupatoria - 17th February 1855
     The Expedition to Kertch - 1855
     The Tchernaya River - 16th August 1855


Includes 17 full colour Bob Marrion plates representing the numerous forces involved in the conflict.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Wargaming in Egypt and the Sudan
Description:
There's something about Victorian colonial exploits that stirs the blood. 
Grim faced, khaki clad infantry faced by overwhelming numbers of tribesmen who know no fear and take on troops armed with modern rifles, artillery and machine guns while they themselves have only hand held weapons. 
In the Sudan it is all there - the 'fuzzy-wuzzies' of Kipling, the Indian, Egyptian and Sudanese troop types, the renowned Highland infantry, the 21st Lancers, the Camel Corps, the Naval Brigade, the Gatling gun, gun boats, arid terrain, the River Nile - marvellous stuff!

The aim of this book is to provide the reader and war gamer with some idea as to how the campaigns were fought and how they might be re-created on the table top.

This scenario booklet covers three campaigns: 

     the Nile Campaign 1882, 
     the Gordon Relief Expedition 1884-1885 and
     the Re-conquest of the Sudan 1895-1896


–description from the publisher

Name: Hack Slash Loot
Description:
This expansion comes with a ton of new content and new mini games to keep the game fresh and funky every time you play it. You will be greeted by 3 new heroes: Rogue, Brawler, and the Artificer. There are also new dungeon tiles to explore, events to defeat, more pets to love, and spells to learn.

NEW CONTENT
CHEAT CODES: It has a new Cheat Chest in which you must pick the lock to even open it. If you open the chest, you will be granted with a very powerful cheat code.

WANDERING MONSTERS: These monsters can make an appearance and really shake things up. When you draw this Monster Enhancer, you must draw a Wander Monster which truly can be at any level of difficulty.

CRAFT: You can now craft in the dungeon. Merge 2 treasures together to create 1 stronger treasure!

NEW CO-OP RULES: There are now better rules for trading items in the dungeon as well as assisting in combat with other heroes.

BONUS EXPANSION SUNKEN TREASURE
This is a bonus expansion that you may include into your game. This includes a new hero; the Beast Tamer.

FISHING: You can now fish on water spaces in the dungeon. If you are able to catch these fish, you may feed them to your pets. This will transform your pet into a strong monster with a greater bonus stat. Of course, this is temporary and your pet will then transform back at the start of the next floor.

SUNKEN TREASURES: You can even gain new treasures by fishing, one of which is the powerful artifact THE 7 SEAS SWORD!!!!

—description from the publisher

Name: Stuart Asquith's Wargaming 18th Century Battles
Description:
This book focuses on one of the Stuart Asquith's key interests, 18th century warfare. 
The attractions of the period are described, along with nine accounts of key battles 1704-1760. These battles include:

     Battle of the Schellenberg (1704) 
     Battle of Ramillies (1706) 
     Battle of Sheriffmuir (1715) 
     Battle of Mollwitz (1741) 
     Battle of Soor (1745) 
     Battle of Falkirk (1746) 
     Battle of Plassey (1757) 
     Battle of Minden (1759) 
     Battle of Warburg (1760) 


Of course, the book would not be complete without a set of classic 'Old School' wargaming rules. 
The obvious choice was Stuart Asquith's popular wargaming rules for Malburian Warfare 1702-1714.

This work is published as part of The History of Wargaming Project range of books that aim to document the development of wargaming.

–description from the publisher
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession
History: War of the Spanish Succession

Name: Word for Word
Description:
Each player takes five face-down letter tablets after shuffling. Divide black tablets equally between all the players. Players then take turns placing black tablets on the board, leaving at least one square (including diagonally) between tablets. Players then take turns making words on the board using the letter tablets, ensuring that the word fits between two black tablets. Each tablet in a completed word scores one point. Highest score wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Ho-Mo
Description:
The game is similar to Chess or Draughts. The game board is a 17x25 square grid with red lines demarcating the center circle and penalty areas, hence resembling a soccer field. Five squares on each half of the playing field has a ball. Each player has 11 pawns. Players move alternately and the objective is to move the players directly behind the ball squares. There is no moving ball in this game.

—user summary

Name: Spartacus: Rome Under Threat
Description:
Lead the rebellion or defend the Republic in the dramatic Third Servile War!

This 1-2 player tabletop game pits you against your opponent in a desperate struggle for freedom or order. As the Slave Rebellion, you'll gather support, raid Roman territories, and fight for survival. As the Roman Republic, you'll hunt down the rebellion and crush any threat to your power.

Solo mode challenges you to lead the rebels against a cunning AI opponent.

Experience history come alive with a beautiful hex & counter map and stunning illustrated cards. Each card offers command points, events, and combat abilities, bringing strategic depth and tactical choices to every encounter. Roll the dice and unleash devastating attacks, leveraging unique battle conditions and tactical maneuvers to gain the upper hand.

Will you spark a revolution or uphold the Republic? Take command and rewrite history in The Third Servile War!

Name: MadMobz
Description:
MadMobz is a card game that revolves around the idea of rival mobz. Every player commands a different mob, each with their own house, business and car. Everyone has action cards (such as an attack, defend, swat, etc.) with different characteristics and have to properly use them in order to win. The players have to deal with ripdeals, snitches, SWAT teams, gold diggers, hustlers as well as other possible obstacles. In order to win, each participant has to manage resources and eliminate the rival mobz.

How do you play MadMobz?


     Choose your infamous gang! Who are you? The Chicago Boss, The Sicilian Family, The Mexican Cartel, The NY Connection, The Cuban Stars, The Colombian King, or The Black Widow.
     Put your gang members in the right place and take out all other gangs!
     Make sure to attack their car, business and home to take out the Gangleader!


The game has 88 playing cards and 40 team cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Selsia
Description:
You are a spaceship captain and you cruise your ship between planets to create your own destiny. You can perform different kinds of jobs. You can be a bounty hunter or sabotage others. You can deliver cargo or perform heroic acts. You want to become famous and it is up to you to decide how to reach your objectives. You might get involved into politics and decide to support the terrans or the Aeroneans. Or you might ignore both and try to pick your own quest. The possibilities are limitless in Selsia, but one thing remains constant: you must keep getting stronger! Upgrade your spaceship and recruit crew members to help you reach your goals.

Selsia is a 1-4 players game that takes 30-75 minutes to play. Players will compete throughout the game for fame. The player with the most fame points wins. In Selsia, the following mechanisms are utilized: action selection, area control, pickup and delivery, rondel movement and dice rolling.

In the start of the game, each player get their own spaceships. Later on, players will have the chance to upgrade different parts of their spaceships using a catalog of at least 28 unique upgrades that allow different strategies and provide a high replay value. Each upgrade slots into the player board based on its type giving a nice visual appeal and a sense of advancement. Players will install new weapons, better defense systems, stronger battery units, better engines, ...

Selsia uses various unique and easy to grasp mechanisms. Players have to move their spaceships and perform an action, it's that simple. The rules are easy to learn, but making the right decision is not so easy. There are many strategies available to choose from, and the best of them all is revealed only at the end of each game. And the icing on the cake is a novel, rewarding and exciting combat system.

—description from the publisher

Name: MadSoccer X Touzani
Description:
In MadSoccer, every player will be responsible for their own national football team, making sure to tactically defeat the opponents. Everyone has action cards (including attack, defence, penalties, etc.) with different characteristics, and has to properly and thoughtfully use them in order to win. For the game to end, the participants have to manage resources and eliminate the defenders, midfielders and strikers of the rival teams.

How To Play:

     Choose your favourite football team! (Netherlands, Belgium, Spain, France, Germany, Portugal, Turkey, and England)
     Put your players in the right place and take out all opponents!
     First, defeat their defenders - midfielders - forwards and score a goal to kick your opponents out of the tournament.


Defeat your opponents by using attack cards to take out their players. With the action cards, you can bully your fellow players by, for example, taking their cards, having them skip a turn, stealing a player and even more 'nasty' bullying cards! Of course, you can also defend your players in this game with the defence cards (blocks the attack card) or the offside card (blocks the action card). There are also 'super cards' in the game, each of which has a special power. If you really quickly kick your opponent out of the tournament, throw up the 'Penalty' card to take out multiple players immediately. Each team also has a Coach and can be used against the most dangerous attacks to defend you from the other player's attempts to score a goal.

—description from the publisher

Met MadSoccer breng je de spanning van het EK naar je woonkamer! MadSoccer geeft jou de kans met jouw team de rest van de andere teams te verslaan en zo de competitie te winnen.

—description from the publisher (Dutch)

Name: Abduction!
Description:
(from the rulebook)
They're here!
Abduction is a set of fast play Sci-Fi rules. They are set in a near future America, in a time when alien encounters have become common, and fights between American defence forces and alien snatch squads are everyday occurences. These rules are designed to recreate these encounters; fighting small skirmishes between a dozen or so human figures and a handful of aliens.

Published as 16p A5 booklet, also containing a quick reference sheet.

Name: Dark Overlord Reigns
Description:
Dark Overlord Reigns is a semi-abstract game of warfare that takes place in a forsaken fantasy world. White cubes represent forces that allow you to protect, fight, and perform tasks. You also manage three heroic leaders that journey around the tile map to aid your forces against the Dark Overlord; the rising threat to the free nations.

Designed as a solitaire game, forces of the Dark Overlord are controlled by the game system. These forces consist of black cubes (dark army), blue cubes (hellbreed), and purple cubes (ghoul hordes). The dark army represents the overlord’s regular army, the hellbreed represents his supernatural army, and the ghoul hordes represent his enslaved army.

Throughout the game you are attempting to build up your white cubes while keeping the rival cubes to a minimum. A major feature in the game is “worker placement”. To overcome the Dark Overlord you must have your task force cubes (workers) fulfill various missions in order to recruit more forces and outwit the Dark Overlord. Ultimately, you must prevail in a final battle on the center tile in order to win the game.

A game turn consists of 3 phases. The first phase involves the emergence of rival cubes. The second phase involves the fulfilment of task spot effects (based on the accomplishments of your task force cubes). The third phase of the turn allows you decision-making opportunities using your heroes. At this point you can move your heroes, perform combat, deploy forces, pick up forces, and drop off runestones.

—description from the designer

Name: Tridoru
Description:
Tridoru is a fast paced strategy game where two players will represent a clan, Mikoto or Kawagama, trying to conquer the reign of Tridoru.

Clans will use cards to deploy troop tokens in a 3x3 square grid board. You will have to carefully select these cards, since they will deploy your troops, but they will also deploy the other clan's troops.

Once a square has enough troop tokens on it, the clan will deploy a camp token on it. The first player who completes 3 squares in a row with camps wins the game. But watch the other clan, as they can steal your position.

—description from the designer

Name: Дата: Фрагменти Історії (Date: Fragments of History)
Description:
Ð”Ð°Ñ‚Ð°: Ð¤Ñ€Ð°Ð³Ð¼ÐµÐ½Ñ‚Ð¸ Ð†ÑÑ‚Ð¾Ñ€Ñ–Ñ— ("Date: Fragments of History") is a quick historical game designed in the style of comic books.
The game includes 100 events from the political and cultural life of Ukraine. The players need to arrange their events correctly in a chronological order and prevent their opponents from doing so.

The game is similar to Timeline: General Interest.

Name: Bog-a-ten
Description:
Being a lively distraction for gentlemen and ladies not of a nervous disposition, involving cards and miniature figurines.

The game is an expedition towards the mystical temple of Bog-a-ten. Parties travel from island to island, encountering prehistoric monsters, traps, and other enemies.

The game started as a  convention game at Salute '97 (miniature wargaming convention), but the rules were published as an A4 spiral-bound rulebook, counting 18 pages.

Each player starts with a party onboard a small ship. Movement by ship is between islands. Once the party sets foot on an island, an encounter can occur, a trap can be found, etc. The goal of the game is to reach the island with the temple, and trying to escape again, upon which the game is won by that party.

The whole game is played on a table with scenery, miniatures, etc.

—description from the publisher

Name: Might and Main
Description:
These rules are designed for wargaming naval battles of the medieval age in the seas of Western Europe. The rules aim to give the feel of the period, whilst being simple and fast-playing. Book-keeping has been kept to a minimum and the types of ships involved have been simplified into broad categories.

—description from the rulebook

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Greyjoy Starter Set
Description:
While the natives of the Iron Islands technically bend the knee to whomever sits the Iron Throne, the Ironborn are taking full advantage of the chaos in Westeros to raid its coastlines and mercantile shipping like never before. The Ironborn are not an army dedicated to protracted engagements, but rather a rapid-moving force built around subduing enemies and inflicting as much damage as possible before fading back into the Sunset Sea from whence they came. In an age of strife and internecine war, the only true victors are those that carry away the greater share of the spoils, and the Ironborn are built to do exactly that.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stormcrow Dervishes
Description:
Stormcrow Dervishes represent some of their best-trained veteran troops. These hardened veterans can move rapidly despite medium armor, and attack exposed elements, even at long distances across the battlefield. As with all Stormcrows, a little extra coins goes a long way, and these veterans didn't get where they are by taking coin without delivering added performance. They can engage swiftly from surprising distances, strike hard, then fade back to the relative safety of their own lines. If pinned, they can hold their own against even heavy troops, though not for long. Staying mobile is their best defense.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – War Mammoths
Description:
Although not many Mammoths remain in the world, those trained by the Free Folk and their Giant allies are true juggernauts of destruction on the battlefield. While their size makes them easy targets, their thick, hairy hides shrug off even strong blows. Mammoths attack with their tusks, trunk, and feet, and few units can withstand a Mammoth on the rampage. Such a beast ignores enemy lines and tramples anything in its path. Mammoths are well-trained and difficult to rattle, which is fortunate, because a panicked Mammoth is one's ally on the battlefield.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Ironmakers
Description:
The heavily armored men of House Ironmaker often serve as the main center of an Ironborn force where a dedicated line is called for. Their thick scale armor over boiled leather allows them to withstand strong assaults and even cavalry charges. That said, their "heavy armor" is equivalent to the medium infantry of most landbound forces. But the Ironborn have always been a mobile force, and even this heavier version of their signature scale mail offers superior mobility. Used intelligently, the Ironmakers can even the odds against even the strongest enemies.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Ironborn Trappers
Description:
Capturing thralls is part of the Ironborn reaving tradition, and the Ironborn Trappers excel at bringing enemies in alive. Trappers are not built for the front lines, but rather for flanking and hindering heavier enemy units with their long, barbed spears and entangling nets. With Trappers on one side and virtually any other unit on the other, even the most heavily armored knights will find themselves overwhelmed and defeated in short order. That said, Trappers are not suited to protracted engagements, and fall easy prey to long-range archery.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Greyjoy Heroes I
Description:
With the Seven Kingdoms distracted by internecine war, the Kraken banner rises once more to threaten coastlines across Westeros! The lords and heroes of House Greyjoy lead their armies to victory in skirmishes and raids, bringing back the spoils of the fertile mainland. From Theon's reckless tactics to Euron's subtle cruelty to Balon's formidable strategies, House Greyjoy is poised to reap rewards far beyond those ever written of in the sagas of old. With them come their loyal retainers Erik Ironmaker, Qarl the Maid, Nute the Barber, and Maester Wendamyr, powerful champions and political players in their own right, each ready and willing to pay the Iron Price for their lords.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Scutarii: Tournament Edition
Description:
Scutarii: Tournament Edition is a complete miniatures system for the Age of Antiquity. 
Covering the period from 3000 B.C. to 1450 A.D., Scutarii brings to gamers a fast-paced system with all the detail designed to resolve large scale battles within three to four hours.

     Covers all the major and minor weapons and tactics
     Can use any basing and scale from other popular rulesets 
     Get a conclusion within three to four hours
     Designed for scenario and tournament play
     Complete point system and various optional rules
     Full army lists included
     Nine complete scenarios included: Hydaspes, Raphia, Pharsalus, Nemea, Marathon, Asculum, Callinicum and more!
     Conversion tools for using other popular army lists
     Weather, terrain and strategic movement


–description from the back of the book
Families: History: Greek & Persian conflicts of the 4th century BC
History: Wars of Alexander the Great
History: Wars of the Diadochi and Syrian Wars

Name: Eagle's Prey: Advance & Retreat – Regimental Rules for the American Civil War 1861-1865
Description:
Eagle's Prey: Advance & Retreat Regimental Rules for the American Civil War 1861-1865 is a complete and comprehensive supplement for the Age of Lincoln and the American Civil War!

Advance & Retreat allows players to refight the struggle the Union!  

     Refight the battles or create new ones with our scenario generation tools  
     Allows for a 20,000 man game to be completed in 3-4 hours 
     Can be used with any scale and no rebasing needed  
     Covers the various factions and forces list  
     Features HRG’s Terrain Generation system 
     Follows historical organization and unit capabilities  
     Includes a Scenario generator and player aid tools  
     Rated Leaders for Brigade and Division command  
     Command Brigade Level or regimental action
     Includes a scenarios with more available online Features Naval rules for transports
     Can be used with CASEMATE & CANNON Civil War Naval Rules


–description from back of the book

Name: Dark Domains: 2020 Lab Rat Gift Cards
Description:
A set of six Obscure Arcana card that can be added to the base game's fortune card mix.

Includes: Aeon, TheUniverse, The Void, Aether, The Four Winds, and Time

These were originally sent as gifts to the Lab Rats of Laboratory H.

Name: KeyForge Adventures: Abyssal Conspiracy
Description:
After defeating the Keyraken, the first adventure in KeyForge Adventures, the Archons find that the danger has not yet abated, for their ship is crippled by a mysterious saboteur who escapes before justice can be served! In this second adventure, you must navigate a grid of nine locations as you descend into the ocean’s depths to uncover the conspiracy and find the tool you will need to put an end to its villainy. Exploring the ocean’s depths is a dangerous and uncertain undertaking, and whatever force is attempting to foil the Archons is not waiting around to be stopped. As the tide shifts against you, can you stop this conspiracy before it unleashes an otherworldly power across the Crucible?

—description from the publisher

Name: War of the Ring: The Fate of Erebor
Description:
The Fate of Erebor is a promotional item included with copies of "The Battle of Five Armies" Collector's Edition and given out with first print copies of the revised edition of "The Battle of Five Armies" board game.

It is an alternate setup of "War of the Ring" with which you can play when the Shadow player wins "The Battle of Five Armies" board game. Contains alternate map tiles, character cards, and event cards for the "War of the Ring" base game.
Families: Series: War of the Ring (Nexus/Ares Games)

Name: Pizza KATA
Description:
Pizza KATA (where KATA stands for “KAnban TakeAway) is a serious game where you can combine a fast paced real time card game with all metrics normally adopted in kanban such as a visualise the flow, time measure, tickets, timers,…

Each pack can be used by a single team of 3 to 6 players, with roles and challenging activities. You can easily use the material of the game to scale to many teams in competitive or collaborative mode, so you can create workshops up to 30 people with a single facilitator (with more facilitators the game can further scale).

The game is articulated in different “days” where every team try to improve their performance and increase performance and predictability of the activities. In fact the term “kata” (Japanese word for “model”) is also adopted in martial arts with the philosophy of practice to perfection.

In the pack you can find also material to track and measure activities, so in the retrospective (between two days) you have numbers to understand the impact of the decision taken by the team.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Pizza Box Sports (On The Line Game Company)

Name: The Goonies: Under the Goondocks – A Never Say Die Expansion
Description:
Troy and his father's plan to turn the Goondocks into a country club have failed. But since The Goonies discovered that One-Eyed Willie's treasure was real, Troy has been searching for it out of spite. You must stop him before he unleashes the evils below The Goondocks!
 With the help of Stef, Andy, and Brand, you must stop Troy from finding One-Eyed-Willie's treasure before it's too late!

This expansion is a thrilling continuation of The Goonies: Never Say Die story filled with new foes, treasures, and characters over three exciting adventures!

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel United: X-Men – First Class
Description:
X-Men: First Class is a Kickstarter Exclusive expansion that brings the first appearance of the X-Men to life! Go back to the first days of Xavier’s School for Gifted Youngsters and play with the original incarnation of these iconic Heroes and Villains. These characters not only have game pieces that reflect their classic looks, but also their game mechanics reflect a less experienced and more “raw” version of them. The Maximoff twins, Scarlet Witch and Quicksilver, form a unique villainous duo, working together to bring down the Heroes. And finally, the set of Locations contained in this expansion also bring the Danger Room, a special Location attachment that gives Heroes access to special Training!

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel United: X-Men – The Horsemen of Apocalypse
Description:
The Horsemen of the Apocalypse is an epic Kickstarter Exclusive expansion that pits the X-Men against the might of the first mutant: Apocalypse. And to make matters worse, Apocalypse is not alone, as he has gathered his four lieutenants around him to help carry out his apocalyptic plan. In ride the four horsemen: Famine, War, Pestilence, and Death.

Players can choose to face Apocalypse directly, in a daunting game where the Four Horsemen are his Threats, but with their character pieces present on the play area and moving around the Locations to sow destruction. If they want the ultimate challenge, however, players can use the Four Horsemen Mode, where the battle against Apocalypse is preceded by a game against just the Four Horsemen. They will have to face each Horseman, one by one, each with a reduced Master Plan deck and their own set of rules and challenges. By being victorious, players will be able to take extra Action tokens to the final battle against Apocalypse. However, each Horseman that succeeds will be a more powerful Threat in the final game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel United: X-Men – Gold Team
Description:
The X-Men: Gold Team expansion brings another iconic X-Men team, featuring classic Heroes that will each bring their own twist to the game. It also features a Villain that will bring the full power of the Hellfire Club to bear against the X-Men. That is, if the X-Men can stop fighting against each other long enough to take care of this menace, as this expansion also contains all the contents and rules necessary to play the Team vs Team Mode.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel United: X-Men – Blue Team
Description:
The X-Men: Blue Team expansion would be awesome enough if it only added to the game this beloved team of X-Men, each with their own unique abilities, and fighting against a Villain with a most sinister plan to extract mutant DNA. But it also carries the new Team vs Team mode and all it brings to the table.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel United: X-Men – Phoenix Five
Description:
Phoenix Five is a Kickstarter Exclusive expansion that brings a momentous saga to Marvel United. The mysterious Phoenix Force has taken over 5 powerful heroes, turning them into a group of Villains whose unbridled power few can withstand. It will be up to the X-Men, with the aid of Hope Summers, to face a daunting campaign against the Phoenix Five. The outcome of each battle affects the next, and each subsequent foe accumulates more of the Phoenix Force, posing a greater challenge.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel United: Deadpool
Description:
The Deadpool expansion brings you a whopping three flavors of the Merc with a Mouth, as well as his not so trusty sidekick Bob, Agent of Hydra. These most unusual characters can all be played as either Heroes or Villains, always with tongue stuck firmly in cheek. Not content with being just a 4th wall-breaking Hero and unbeatable Villain, Deadpool can also crash into any game, riding his plush unicorn, in the form of a Challenge that sows chaos wherever he goes!

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel United: X-Men – X-Force
Description:
Created by Cable out of the remnants of the New Mutants, the X-Force is unlike other X-Men teams who focus on reacting to Villain’s schemes and protecting the innocents. Following Cable’s philosophy of “Get them before they get you,” the X-Force is an aggressive team who actively attacks evil mutants every chance they get.

This Kickstarter Exclusive Expansion for Marvel United includes four heroes, one villain, and four locations.

Name: Marvel United: X-Men – Days of Future Past
Description:
Days of Future Past is a Kickstarter Exclusive expansion that brings by far the largest foes your Heroes have ever faced, the giant Sentinels! Join Logan in a timeline when mutants are being systematically hunted down by these mechanical terrors. Like clockwork, these titanic robots follow an activation protocol that adapts to the Heroes’ every move. You will have to band together and bring them down as quickly as possible, before the powerful Nimrod is fully activated, if you are to have any chance of defeating him.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel United: Fantastic Four
Description:
This Kickstarter Exclusive Optional Buy brings Marvel’s First Family to Marvel United! Join the fantastic Dr. Richards, Sue, Johnny, and Ben, with the cosmic aid of the mysterious Silver Surfer, as they use unparalleled teamwork to battle the nefarious plans of Doctor Doom across all new Locations being taken over by his unstoppable Doombots!

—description from the publisher

Name: Hungry for Humans
Description:
In Hungry for Humans, you have a monster friend who really, really wants to eat you. But if you feed it the best human food we have to offer, you will curb its human hunger and help it become the most powerful monster in the wild. Luckily, you’ve discovered the scenic hills of West Virginia - the one place in the world where the food is delicious enough, the people are friendly enough, and the landscape is majestic enough to take the edge off any monster’s human hunger. Here, your monster will take part in a weekend of feasting on the world’s best cuisine. But be careful, your fellow humans may try to sabotage your monster’s next meal and leave you to become a human corn dog.

Each round the humans will submit dishes to a meal that the hungriest monster will eat. The hungriest monster is decided by the Hunger Level tiles which the humans will secretly choose for their monster before each meal is revealed. The meal will be revealed and the humans will then play Monster Power cards to sabotage other monsters or help their own. The Hunger Level tiles will then be revealed and the hungriest monster will eat the meal and add the total to its Power Level. If a monster eats too fast and exceeds level 20 it becomes too powerful and explodes. If it doesn’t eat the right stuff and goes below level 1, it becomes hangry and eats its human. The most powerful monster standing after 15 meals will be the winner!

Name: Pirate Raid
Description:
A simple skirmish game each players commands a small group of pirates raiding a Caribean village. 
The villagers and any relief force are controlled by the rules.

Be the one to bring home the most loot and win the game.

Turn sequence:

     At the start of each turn randomly decide the order that the players will activate in, which ever player is last draws a random event card and immediately plays it. 
     The players then take it in turns to move their figures fight combats and so on, after everyone has moved any defenders or relief force troops are moved. 
     From the start of turn 5 the player who is moving last instead on drawing a random event card rolls on the relief force table and places any troops as required.

Name: Wild West Gunfight
Description:
A simple game to recreate the gunfights common to most westerns and that even occasionally happened in real life. 
Each player is assigned a force of about six figures and off you go.

Designed for 28mm figures but will work fine with what ever figures you have, could be played as a one against one game or, with an umpire, larger multi player games where everyone has a different objective.

Turn sequence:

     Each player places their figure cards in a pile in front of themselves face down in the order they want to activate them in, the top card being the one they want to activate first.
     Randomly decide who moves first then activate figures alternately until all figures have been activated.


—description from the publisher / rulebook

Name: Cat Go Nirvana: Awaken Question Battle Game
Description:
This game is racing to slow down. It's a good game for practicing to ask powerful question.

The game invites you to think, analyze, consider to slow down your points. Be with yourself for longer to win the game.

With game mechanics the player who slow, the more people want to question you. More good questions from friends who playing together.

Today we try to get the answers that are in front of each other quickly. But it doesn't mean the answer is yours. The answer that is most suitable for you or The answer that maximizes your potential.

—description from the designer

Name: Warburg 1760
Description:
Julyâ€¯1760. The Coalition army commanded by Ferdinand of Brunswick falls back in the face of the French army, commanded by Broglie. To cut off the retreat of the Coalition, the Chevalier duâ€¯Muy is sent north across the Diemel toward Warburg. Meanwhile, the German troops cross farther east at Liebenau. Duâ€¯Muy deploys his army alongside the Diemel with its back to the river. Thanks to a turning movement masked by light troops of the British Legion and the mist of the morning, the troops commanded by the Hereditary Prince and Spörcken position themselves on the French left flank. At 13.00 this 31 July, the British and Hanoverian grenadiers appear at the rear of the French line, the Bourbonnais brigade counter-attacks, marking the beginning of a ferocious battle…
 Warburg 1760 uses a simplified version of the rules of Corbach 1760 featured in VaeVictis #142.

One strength point =â€¯ 150-200 men for the cavalry, 200-250 for the infantry
One hexagon =â€¯250â€¯m
One turn =â€¯30â€¯minutes
Difficulty =â€¯5/10
Possibility for solo play =â€¯6/10

—description from the publisher

Name: Cartabad
Description:
The little brother of cartaping :-)

Cartabad is a Badminton card game.

The goal is to win the match which is played in two winning sets of 11 points.

Player plays cards in his turn. There are 4 type of cards in this game:

     Red cards impose a particular constraint to the opponent.
     Green cards increase the possibilities of their owner.
     Violet cards change the game for both players.
     Orange cards change the other cards


Each card has a name, a particular effect, and acts for a specified period.

On each card are shown:

     The effect of the card: "what"
     To whom it is addressed: "who"
     How long it will work: "when"

Name: Meadow: Envelope P
Description: Meadow: Envelope P is a set of 8 out-of-this-world creatures, objects and places cards to add to your Meadow. Shuffle cards from this set into corresponding decks and make your collection even more amazing.

Name: みっしょんずかっぷ！！ (Missions cup!!)
Troy: Green Expansion
Description:
Kickstarter exclusive of green cards.  These add extra unknowns into the game of earthquake, poison, mourning and disease.
All affect both players and change the game.  Some will even finish the game when played.  All done when double 6 is rolled by a player.

—description from the designer

Name: Schuss auf's Tor!
Description:
The players roll three dice and split up the result to move one or more figures and the ball. The figures may move in any direction. The ball only moves straight away from a figure placed immediately behind the ball. Most soccer rules are simulated in the game.

The player who gets the most goals in a fixed time span (for example 2 x 30 minutes) wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Monstropoly Battle Card Game
Description:
In this game set in the universe of the stage personas of the Finnish Metal Band Lordi, every card is a monster. You, as a player, are trying to make a team of monsters that can help you most effectively slaughter your opponent's monsters.

The first phase of the game is played by playing single monsters from the players' hands and comparing "Force." The highest force wins. The winner of that match up (Or "round") draws a card from the top of the deck and decides to keep either it and one of the played cards, or both played cards, yielding the one remaining card to the loser.

When the entire deck is depleted and both players have their teams, they check to see point totals. A whole "Team" Based on its lead characters is worth Ten points, incomplete teams are only worth one point per character(For a maximum of four) if you have no complete teams, you lose automatically. The hands are broken up into their teams and incomplete ones are compiled into another deck.

The player with the least points starts the team battles by playing one card from one team and may only use this team until it is gone, same with the enemy player. A third card is drawn from the deck to determine weapon values of both cards. The highest total force still wins. The game ends when all teams have been returned to the deck and the player with the most points wins the battle.

—user summary

Name: Marvel United: X-Men – Kickstarter Promos Box
Description:
This set contains all the exclusive stretch goals unlocked during the Kickstarter, including a box to store everything.

Heroes (34):    

        Blink
        Boom-Boom
        Captain Britain
        Cloak
        Dagger
        Dazzler
        Doop
        Fantomex
        Feral 
        Firestar
        Gwenpool
        Havok
        Kitty Pride
        Longshot
        Magik
        Mirage
        Multiple Man
        Nightcrawler
        Phoenix
        Pixie
        Polaris
        Strong Guy
        Sunfire
        Sunspot
        Warlock
        Warpath
        Weapon X
        Wolfsbane
        X-23


(Alpha Flight team)

        Guardian
        Puck
        Northstar
        Sasquatch
        Snowbird


    
Anti-heroes (5):    

        Emma Frost
        Legion
        Marrow
        Namor
        Spiral


    
Villains (15):    

        Arcade
        Avalanche
        Brood Queen
        Blob, Pyro, Toad (Brotherhood of Evil Mutants)
        Callisto
        Dark Phoenix
        Deathbird
        Lady Deathstrike
        Mastermind
        Mojo
        Omega Red
        Onslaught
        Sauron
        The Shadow King
        Silver Samurai

Name: Marvel United: X-Men – Old Man Logan
Description:
Kickstarter Exclusive miniature only available with Uncanny Pledge but is packaged in its own box.

An additional hero.

Contents:
Old Man Logan Miniature
12 Cards

Name: Marvel United: X-Men – Storm (Mohawk)
Description:
Kickstarter Exclusive Miniature packaged in its own box, only available with Apocalypse or Uncanny Pledge.

An additional hero.

Storm with a Mohawk
12 cards

Name: Murder Bunnies: The Killer Card Game
Description: Murder Bunnies is a 2-player strategy game where every ability has a trigger, and every turn could be your last. Capture, Spawn, Move, or Attack enemy bunnies on the field using your action points to maximize your murder and earn your share of the Carrot Bounty. But be careful - every bunny has an ability with a trigger built in, so plan your moves wisely.

Name: Two Stand To Fall
Description:
You and your partner stand against a terrible Crisis.

It shouldn’t have been anything new; the two of you had surpassed many hardships before, and forged a bond stronger than steel together. Together, you were supposed to be powerful.

But this time, things went horribly wrong. Even with your strengths combined, your last battle was certain to end in your defeat.

And so, your partner made the ultimate sacrifice: they sent you back to safety, while they stayed to fight the Crisis alone.

Two Stand To Fall is a solo storytelling game about people who would sacrifice for each other, in the face of a world that seeks their destruction.

Perhaps they live, in spite of the world. Perhaps they die, and are forever separated.

But there is a chance you both will come out alive. Therefore, you must try.

Name: Board Game of Kaaba
Description:
As technology advances, interpersonal communication is weakening by the day.
Children are drowning in a digitalized world while their parents have their hands full with their smartphones.
Therefore, we decided to develop an educational board game to teach children and adults about the Islamic faith through fun and games and to strengthen their relationship and communication with each other.
Especially in this day and age, where there is only ignorance or half-knowledge about Islam, we want to bring light into the darkness with this game.
With this game we also want to address non-Muslims in particular, so that they can gain an insight into Islam.

Gameplay:
The game’s design is that the Kaaba has to be circumnavigated seven times. Circling with the pawn is accomplished by answering questions on Islamic topics. The questions are divided into five difficulty levels. The more difficult the question, the more steps you can take if you answer it correctly. If a player, for example, correctly answers a question from category two, he or she can take two steps forward with the pawn.

Winning:
The goal of the game is to be the first to circle the Kaaba seven times with the pawn. The pawns are moved counterclockwise around the Kaaba just as is the case with the real Kaaba in Mecca. A circle (orbit) occurs every time the player has passed the starting position.

–description from the publisher

Name: Zoo Roll Out
Description:
The concept is simple: Help the animals break out of the zoo. Zoo Break is compact and easy to grasp for kids as young as five, who are still learning their numbers, but it involves strategy and level variations that make it intriguing for the sharpest of gamers. (We challenge advanced gamers to try getting through Levels 1-10 in one play session!) Zoo Break can be played alone, or collaboratively by multiple people. It's a great family game.

To play, simply shuffle the cards and lay them out in an 8x8 grid. Place the four colorful wooden animals in the center. Roll the green dice to guide the animals to freedom, using strategy to choose the best path for each animal. But watch out for the zookeeper! For every roll of the animal dice, you'll also roll the zookeeper dice. The zookeeper locks down cards and closes off escape routes with every roll.

Win the game by breaking out all four animals before their escape routes close. Strategy abounds around which paths to take, and this makes for great interaction with kid co-players. Four free spaces help you on your way. But if the zookeeper locks down a card that is currently occupied by an animal, it's back to the central cage!

—description from the publisher

Name: Capturing Caesar's Camp: A Pint Sized Campaign for Chain of Command
Description:
Capturing Caesar’s Camp is a Pint-Sized campaigns for Chain of Command, designed to be played using the campaign handbook At the Sharp End and the Blitzkrieg 1940 Handbook.
A thirty-two page PDF, Capturing Caesar’s Camp contains an overview of the events of May and early June 1940. as the German panzers dashed across Northern France and the Low Countries, trapping the Allies at Dunkirk and forcing their evacuation.  However, not all of the British forces withdrew across the Channel.  To the South of the Somme, the 51st Highland Division remained to fight alongside their French comrades in the hope that a new defensive line could be formed and a second Britsh Expeditionary Force sent to continue the war.
This campaign focusses on the actions on the Somme, with the British, supported by French guns and armour, attempting to crush a bridgehead held by the German 57th Infantry Division. If the Highlanders can push the Germans back across the Somme, the much anticipated Weygand Line may become a reality and the German advance South checked.
The campaign is a total of Six game tables with the duration running between five and nine games.  
Briefings are provided for both sides, along with measurable objectives, period maps, force and support option listings and everything you need to play this campaign through to its conclusion.

–description from the publisher
Families: Series: Pint Sized Campaigns for Chain of Command

Name: Weed-opoly
Description:
Weed-oploy is the board game where you tractor through the marijuana farm and try to reach End At Stoned first. Succeed and you become the head weedopolist.

Players role a 6 sided die to move around the board. Spaces have isntructions for players to follow. Other players will try to slow you down with "Take-a-Hit" cards. But the "Bad Brownie" cards will give you the opportunity to drive ahead. The "Take a Hit" cards will ask you to "Name at least 5 slang words for Marijuana" or successfully perform tongue twisters. "Bad Brownie" cards come in three categories: SOLO, DUET and ALL PLAY. Some of the challenges include: DUET: "You are staying up late, name places that are open 24 hours a day, compete with another player to name the most". SOLO: "Exercise isn't your thing, name 8 things that inflate". ALL PLAY: "You have the munchies, name types of pies, last player to name one moves up 3 spaces."

To win you will need a few baggies of luck and the ability to answer category questions mistakes. The winner is declared the Head Weedopolist and is entitled to all the rights and privileges it implies.

Name: Sad Days of Battle: The Battle of Jarama, February 6-27, 1937
Description:
“There's a valley in Spain called Jarama. it's a place that we all know so well. It was there that we fought against the fascists. We saw a peaceful valley turn to hell.”—Excerpt from Woody Guthrie’s song Battle of Jarama.

After failing to take Madrid in November, Francisco Franco ordered his forces to cut off the former capital city and now symbol of Republican resistance by taking the roads south of the city linking it to the Republican government in Valencia. The attack over the Jarama river was to be coordinated with the Italian’s offensive to the north and east of the city along the Guadalajara river. However, the Italians were taking longer than anticipated to get their forces into positions, hindered by poor weather and abysmal planning. With growing impatience General Franco ordered his forces to attack, supported by the German Condor Legion as well as masses of new German tanks, artillery pieces and ample supplies of ordinance.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts? Learn and enjoy!

—description from the designer

Name: C4ISR System
Description:
Hex-and-counter, Red v. Blue, brigade/battalion-level wargame of modern land tactical actions, with the emphasis on title's Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Knowledge, Information, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance. Even the basic game requires players to place and move Information Nodes so that their other units can be given orders.

Advanced rules allow the sides to advance beyond the WW II=level paradigm of the basic game, e.g., replacing hierarchical communications trees with true networks that have redundant paths.

Game is in Chines; professionally done eight-page English translation, and two pages of charts, provided.

Name: Catpitals
Description:
Catpitals is a geography-themed card game that engages memory skills, knowledge of capitals of the world, and strategy used as you learn your opponent’s strengths and weaknesses.  The goal of the game is to win the most cards. Gameplay is directed by one of 6 different cats that appear on the cards. Three cats provide players the opportunity to see the country map and its capital on their opponents’ cards, which players will be challenged to successfully remember later in play. The other 3 cats direct various play that allow players to steal or win cards by either correctly naming the capital for a given country, or by carefully selecting an opponent who will not likely know or remember the correct answer.

Each of the 60 cards has a unique colorful map depicting several countries with one or more capitals identified.  One round of the game takes approximately 20 minutes.  The game moves fast enough that several rounds can be played, which has the benefit of introducing more countries and capitals into play.  A more challenging game can be played by requiring all capitals on a given card to be correctly named in order to win the card.

The game can be enjoyed by people of varied ages and knowledge as everyone gets an opportunity to win cards based on their own competencies and strategy.  Ultimately though, as one learns more capitals of the world a distinct advantage will develop, especially if one plays repeatedly.

Name: Svavelvinter: skuggspelet
Description:
In 2013 came the role-playing game "Svavelvinter" where "skuggspelet" is included and can be played as a separate board game.
In Trakoria, powerful and mysterious forces are constantly moving in the shadows, forces whose scheming affects the unaware inhabitants of the archipelago don´t know anything about. To recreate this feeling "Skuggspelet" is used.
A player has won when a shadow power has achieved dominance in a  number of key spheres. On a board with 15 spheres, for example, five can be named key spheres and dominance in three of them is required for victory.

—user summary

Name: Hungry Monster
Description:
Game made with different materials and textures to develop manual dexterity. It can be played in two different ways:
Prepare a pizza with the 4 ingredients depending on what appears on the wheel.
Feed the monster being the first to run out of ingredients.
Educational game to learn different foods.

—user summary

Name: The Isle of Cats: Explore & Draw – Kickstarter Promo Cards
Description:
A set of promotional cards originally given out during the 2021 Kickstarter.

This pack of cards adds "mixed" cards to the game, a new type of card that contain both cats and treasures.

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Roll- or Flip-and-Write Versions of Non-Writing Games

Name: Quest for the Antidote: King's Decoy Promo Card
Description: This promo card was for the limited-edition first print run of Quest for the Antidote. The King’s Decoy meddling card, has a special code in the lower right-hand corner of the card to distinguish it.

Name: Cruel Seas: Drache – helicopter carrier
Description:
The Drache started as a seaplane tender built in Hamburg for the Royal Yugoslavian Navy in 1928. She was converted into a minelayer in 1937. Captured by the Germans in 1941, the Kriegsmarine renamed her the Drache (dragon) and converted her back to a Flugzeugbergungsschiff – an aircraft rescue ship. Drache underwent a refit back to being a minelayer in the spring or summer of 1942 and was moved to the Aegean. She was re-equipped with two 105 mm (4.1") guns, five 37 mm and six 20 mm cannons. A rear platform was added with space for 240 mines on four rails. The Kriegsmarine renamed her Schiff, but she is better known as Drache so the name is retained here. The large flat rear deck made her suitable to test the concept of a helicopter carrier – the world’s first – using a Flettner Fl 282 Kolibri (Hummingbird) as a spotter aircraft.

The Kolibri was the world’s first naval helicopter. It was unarmed but the Kriegsmarine intended to use it for submarine spotting. It could also be used for artillery spotting and reconnaissance.

Pack contains 1 resin & metal vessel and game cards. The full rules for fielding Drache (and helicopter) in Cruel Seas can be found in the Close Quarters supplement

Name: Cruel Seas: Sturmboot 42
Description:
This was a larger version of the original river-crossing sturmboot with an internal engine capable of transporting a platoon rather than a single section. They were also used in enclosed seas such as the Mediterranean and Baltic.

Contains 4 metal boats and game cards.

–description from the publisher

Name: 18 Hex Hex
Description:
A solitaire railway building game consisting of 18 turns, in each of which you fill two hexes with passenger rails and stations, goods rails and factories, plus forests and spoil heaps.

Each turn you roll 7 dice, 4 blue and 3 red. The blue dice are used for passenger lines and stations; the red dice are used for goods lines and factories. You may also use dice to purchase modifiers for use in future turns, including extra dice.

You will gain points mainly for connected stations and factories, but also for a long passenger route and a large group of connected factories. However, you lose points for being forced to place spoil heaps.

—description from the designer

Name: Cruel Seas: Elco Barge-Busters
Description:
In the summer of 1943, the primary mission of the PT boats was to interdict Japanese supply lines by shooting up the enemy landing craft (referred to as barges by American reports) being used to transport supplies. It was at this point that Pacific PT boats were upgraded to have 40 mm/37 mm cannon on the bow and stern. Three old Elco 77’ boats were converted into barge-busters by stripping off the torpedoes and adding extra armour, radar and more MGs.

Contains 2 resin and metal vessels and game cards.

–description from the publisher

Name: Cruel Seas: LCS(L) – Fairmile H
Description:
The LCI(S) was a Fairmile H wooden design using the same prefabrication techniques used in their Dog Boats.  It was designed as a cheap-to-make raider transport. Around 40 were built in 1942. Some were converted to LCS(L) support gunboats.

Contains 2 resin and metal vessels with ship cards.

–description from the publisher

Name: Cruel Seas: Small Sampans
Description:
A player who fields ‘tiny boats’ in Cruel Seas will find their use most entertaining and will undoubtedly make his opposing commander very worried indeed!  The great strength of such vessels is their size but this makes them equally vulnerable to all manner of incoming fire.

As the Japanese merchant marine became ever more depleted the humble Sampan became the main fallback for the Imperial Japanese war machine, delivering vital cargoes of men and equipment. 
Small sampans must be taken in squadrons of three – meaning only one dice is used for all three.

Contains 6 metal boats and game cards.

–description from the publisher

Name: Kharkov, May 1942: The Last Disaster
Description:
May 1942 saw the first major, considered offensive by the Red Army in the war against Germany. Expectations were high, with four Soviet armies aiming to encircle the German Sixth Army and to recapture the fourth largest city in the Soviet Union. Those expectations were dashed within a fortnight by the German Army’s ability to absorb the offensive and launch a counteroffensive of its own which, in its turn, encircled two Soviet armies.

Kharkov, May 1942 – The Last Disaster is a miniature wargames campaign system, designed for two to four players, covering these events. It is designed for games in which a stand represents a platoon or in which the main unit of manoeuvre is the battalion. Suitable rules would include Spearhead, Blitzkrieg Commander, Command Decision: TOB, A Fistful of Tows, Rapid Fire Reloaded and others, including those which wargamers may have written themselves.

The system generates fifty or so hours of gaming spread over ten to fifteen individual battles which are fought over six to fifteen daily campaign turns. The number of turns is flexible and determined by whether either player can encircle the enemy’s forces. Progress in the campaign is measured along campaign tracks representing the two major axes of attack with a number of battlefield ‘spaces’. Each turn players decide whether to attack or not and then which parts of their total forces they commit to any ensuing battle. Battles will generally be around a brigade or regiment of four to eight battalions on each side. The results of each on table battle determine the speed of advance on the main campaign map.

The book includes

     a brief history of the campaign
     background information useful in adapting the system to different sets of rules and suggestions for additional optional rules
     a comprehensive set of Appendices covering
         the Tables of Organisation and Equipment to platoon level for all divisions and regiments involved (around forty regimental sized formations)
         a record of the At Start forces and reinforcements
         a chart to track the position and composition of forces on each attack axis
         19 colour terrain squares of the battlefields (based on nearly 600 square miles of original 1930s maps) which can be used to generate 570 six feet by four feet tabletops
         a Campaign Quick Reference Sheet
         a colour A4 Campaign Map
         a set of suggestions to convert the system to Bob Cordery’s Portable Wargame rules
    



     100 A4 pages with 20+ colour illustrations.


– Description from the publisher

Name: Flames of War: White Death – Mid War Finnish Forces 1942-43
Description:
The Finnish Army had become famous across the world for its epic defence against the 1939 Soviet invasion of the Winter War. In 1941 they joined the Germans in the war against the Soviet Union. The bitter lessons of the Winter War had been well learned. These were further reinforced during the hard fighting of 1941 as they recaptured lost territory and pushed the Red Army back to their original frontiers. With hard-fighting infantry, skilled light infantry, and their newly formed armoured units, the Finnish Army are more than prepared to fight the Soviets to a standstill again.

White Death: Finnish Forces in Mid War contains:

     Background on the Finnish Army and its divisions during Continuation War between 1942 and 1943
     Instructions on how to build an Armoured Company, Light Infantry Company, and a Infantry Company
     Painting and Basing guides
     Basing guide
     Command Cards and Unit Cards


–description from the publisher

Name: Waterloo 2025
Description:
Waterloo 2025 is a second game of the Third World War series, released by Taktyka i Strategia. It's straight continuation of the Ardennes 2024, a game set up in the hypothetical timeline, where modern Germany and Russia form an alliance to take a rule in Europe, where number of resources is decreasing drastically.

Waterloo 2025 starts with a massive riots in Belgium, goes on with a war between former allies and end with a last, massive offensive attempt of the Russian-German coalition. Game contains four scenarios that can be played one after another or stand alone.

Rules are mostly the same as Ardennes 2024, although some clarifications are made and some new rules introduced as well. All the units used in the game are actually existing units of the modern European armies. Game uses battalion scale for the western units and brigade scale for Russian units.

As a wargame, Waterloo 2025 uses typical hex and counter mechanics with I go-you go system and light rules (13 pages or rules and 3 pages of tables.

Name: Commandments Card Game
Description:
A family gin-rummy style game where players take turns drawing and discarding cards while trying to get a set of the ten commandments, but watch out for rebellions and the greatest commandment cards that can make and break sets of commandments quickly.

Collect one each of the Commandment cards before anyone else - including a Greatest Commandment card. Get a dreaded Rebellion card and start over. Designed with color coded cards

—user summary

Name: Svengali
Description:
Part of the Child's Play card game series, Svengali, the psychic's game is a card game where players try to use their psychic abilities to transmit information about their cards to the other players who must either receive a mental image, or simply deduce the clues. Cards feature two shapes of different sizes in two different colors and player get points for correctly guessing the four attributes of a card one at a time, but are penalized by drawing more cards for wrong guesses.

—user summary

Name: Jolly Roger Arithmetic
Description:
Actually four games in one, Jolly Roger is part of the Child's Play card game series.

Cards show various pirate themed pictures on the back sides and jolly roger flags featuring math problems on the other. Families can enjoy snap style games, where players take turns playing cards one at a time until the last two cards match (or any in the pile) depending on which side you choose to play with. In the snap game modes, the player who collects the most cards wins.

Jolly Roger Arithmetic also features the new Jolly Roger game where players take turns playing cards one at a time trying to be the last pirate with cards but a ransom card valued 1 - 4 causes the next player to lose 1 - 4 extra cards unless they can pass along another ransom (which can be played by either side). In the Jolly Roger plunder modes, the last player to still hold any cards wins.

--user summary

Name: Smash Up: Cessare e Desistere & A Che Pensavamo?
Description:
Smash Up: Cease and Desist can be played on its own as a two-player game or combined with other Smash Up titles to allow for up to four players to compete for control of bases at the same time. Cease and Desist includes four factions — Astroknights, Changerbots, Star Roamers, and Ignobles — with 22 cards for each faction. To play, you shuffle together any two factions, whether from this set or any other Smash Up title, then start playing.

Smash Up: What Were We Thinking? returns to the wild randomness of the early days of Smash Up. By combining this expansion with your Smash Up sets, will you take Zombie Rock Stars against Explorer Dinosaurs? What about Time Travelling Grannies versus Teddy Bear Vampires? It’s all possible now! All your dreams can finally come true!

Name: Of the Gods: A Game of Dueling Deities
Description:
The gods are always looking for a chance to squabble, and nothing provides a better excuse than human war. As the armies face off, the gods are looking on with interest. Whose army is the worthiest of glory? Whose army will they descend from the heavens to join in battle? And most importantly, whose army will reign victorious and attract the favor of the gods?

Goal: In this 2-player hand management duel-game, earn the most Victory Points by winning Battles and assembling the greatest Pantheon, gathering more copies of each god than your opponent.

—description from the designer

Name: Railroad Ink Challenge: Epic Board
Description:
Dive into a new adventure with the Epic & Giant boards! These double-sided special boards allow you to further expand your game experience.

The 11×11 Epic board introduces more space to build your networks, trying to connect even more Exits and bypass Mountains that block your path!

The 9×9 Giant board let you play with either the Classic or Challenge dice set, and play with two different expansions together, on a whole new scale!

Each set contains 4 double-sided boards. To play with the Epic board, you need 6 basic Route dice, so two copies of the game are needed.

—description from the publisher

Name: Alpha Zulu
Description: Players simultaneously yell words where the first letter spells other words to win the game.

Name: Heavy Gear Blitz! Tabletop Wargaming: 3rd Edition Rules
Description:
Heavy Gear Blitz!  is a tabletop miniatures wargame with over 20 years of heritage and success.

The colony world of Terra Nova continues to be in a state of constant conflict. Massive polar nations, invaders from Earth and even armed gangs have turned its arid landscape into a never-ending battlefield. Old grudges and fragile alliances set the stage for complete chaos while the Northern, Southern, Peace River and NuCoal Factions fight countless wars in the name of power, profit, revenge or mere survival.

Having failed to conquer Terra Nova once before, Earth has added her subjugated colony worlds to a new Colonial Expedition Force (CEF) invasion force of GRELS, FLAILs, and Hovertanks. Ships blacken the sky, unleashing unending waves of would-be conquerors onto Terra Nova’s war-torn surface. Even Utopia’s newest technological marvels of war have joined the CEF to claim a piece of the planet. Will the factions of Terra Nova unite as they did in the first invasion? Will that be enough this time? Or will Earth grind another planet under her iron heel?

The War for Terra Nova has only just begun... Gear Up and join the battle!

With the Heavy Gear Blitz 3rd Edition Rules you can:

     Enjoy a fast paced, alternating activation game that leaves no player waiting as every action can be reacted to. Choose to play a casual skirmish game with as little as four models or an intense competitive game with 20 or more models.
     Build a force from 10 different Factions and 36 Sub-Factions drawn from multiple worlds of the Heavy Gear Universe.
     Use a “combined arms” approach to future warfare that includes Gears, Striders, Combat Mounts, Hovertanks, Tanks, Infantry, VTOLs, and Aircraft.
     Select from a diverse array of weapons, electronic warfare tools, and many other options to destroy your opponent.
     Wage war using a highly flexible system with customization options for commanders, forces, or even individual models as veterans and duelists.


3rd Edition Rules also includes introduction to the Heavy Gear Universe, objective generation, weapons recognition, reference sheets, and game tokens sheet. Plus model lists for the new plastic miniatures included in the Northern, Southern, Peace River, NuCoal, CEF, Caprice, & Utopia Army Boxes.

Also included are pdfs of the tokens sheet, force record sheet, Terra Nova maps, badlands buildings and stoneheads terrain flat sheets. And our collection of Heavy Gear Blitz paper terrain that you can print on cardboard/cover stock, then cut-out and glue together for some quick tabletop terrain.

—description from the publisher

Name: Heavy Gear Blitz! Two Player Starter Box
Description:
The Heavy Gear Blitz! Two Player Starter Box provides everything two players need to get started:

     the New Northern Plastic Miniatures Army, 
     New Southern Plastic Miniatures Army, and 
     Full Color Quick Start Rulebook (2nd edition).


Scale: 1/144

–Description from the publisher

Name: Potato Inferno!: Demonotized Spudtuber
Description:
This is an expansion for Potato Inferno, including 25 new cards and 6 spud-tuber tokens!

Join the spud-tubers in the ups and downs of potato themed content!

Will you be demonetized? or dominate the Internet with the power of potatoes!

—description from the designer

Name: BattleFish
Description:
The way I see it, if I knew that one day I would either get sautéed in butter, rolled into a sushi roll, or fried up and served with a side of chips, I would want to do something about it too.

In Battle Fish you are in an epic capture the flag battle for control over the seas. Build your army of fish-controlled battle robots, and protect your base at all costs. Win by conquering your enemy before they conquer you.

BattleFish is a family friendly, strategic capture the flag card game. It is easy to learn, with simple rules, easy setup, quick playtime, replay-ability, and a difficulty level that varies with the group you are playing with (making it so that all ages can play.)

You can play in groups of 2-6 and you can play as teams or as individuals. The game starts from the moment you begin setting up the game. You use your cards to strengthen your base and protect your flag or to attack your enemies and steal their flags. The winner is the last player (or team) with their flag still in play.

—description from the designer

Name: Quizine
Description: Quizine is a food trivia game played in teams (recommended) or individually. You move along a track, and have to answer questions or fulfill tasks printed on cards, depending on the kind of field you landed on. Tasks include drawing a food or cooking related item, and explaining an item without mentioning it. Correct answers or correct guesses from your teammates move your pawn forward, and the goal is to reach the central field first.

Name: Pick 1
Description:
Pick 1 is a card game in which you try to get rid of your hand cards as early as possible. Cards either show a number and one of three colors, or a penalty in one of the colors. 
In each turn, one card from the stack is flipped open. Each player simultaneously picks a matching  card from their hand (matching means: same color or same number/penalty). All chosen cards are then revealed. The player who played the highest card in the same number as the open card gets all the penalties, which are either to draw cards from the stack or to steal a card from another player. 
When one player gets rid of all their cards, everyone gets points for the cards still left in their hand (number cards count their value, penalty cards count 10 points). When a player hits 100 points, whoever has least points, wins.

Name: Playmobil: Dragon Fight
Description:
The box contains a total of 32 cards, namely:

     24 warrior cards
     4 joker cards (one for each symbol/strength)
     4 rule cards


In Playmobil Dragon Fight players play cards to win tricks.  Unlike other trump card games, this game uses four different suits, from which the player can choose to play their card for.  Every card has four symbols/strengths, these are: Tactic, Attack, Defense and Range.

At the start of the game, the warrior cards are shuffled and all are dealt among the players as equally as possible.  Every player gets one joker card, the remaining joker cards are removed from the game.  After receiving their cards, players put them -face down- in front of them.

The starting player takes the top card from his deck and pick one of the four symbols to play.  They call out both the symbol and the point value.  Then the other players take the top card of their decks and call out the point value for the chosen symbol and show their cards to prove their claims.  The player with the highest point value in the chosen strength wins the trick and places all cards -face down- at the bottom of their stack.  The game continues until a single player owns all the cards.

Jokers can be used to win a trick, they always have the highest point value.  But they can only be played at beginning of the turn or if the corresponding symbol has been called out.

—user summary

Name: Komockarspelet
Description:
Children's games where it is important to have luck and a good memory. Help the farmer clean Rosa's paddock. The one who fills his wheelbarrow with the most cow dung wins! Rosa loves food and it is important to remember where your favorite food is. Without food - no cow dung in the wheelbarrow.

—user summary

Name: saKodo
Description:
Fill your backpack with memories, adventures and stories gleaned from around the world and be the first to reach the airport with a full bag!
Each card is a pretext to discover a distant culture; the change of scenery is guaranteed!
To move, you don't need a dice: you get caught hitchhiking by other players, or you pay according to the distance traveled.
